image_requirements.description: DO iron or steam the clothing before photographing it.
DON'T stretch the garment on the model or mannequin. Garment should rest naturally.
DON'T have any items or hair obstructing the garment.
DO keep the garment a little bit scrunchy, as it normally would hang on a body.
On mannequin, the garment should NOT be too loose, droopy on sides, and no puckering.
DON'T tuck in the shirt or top; the system can adjust that.
If you have long sleeves, style them how you want, rolled up if appropriate.
DON'T have the top obstructing the bottoms; roll the top up evenly.
DO follow the rule to do the least amount of styling possible.

summary: This page outlines styling guidelines for photographing apparel, emphasizing the importance of natural presentation, avoiding obstructions, and minimal styling for optimal visual representation.
